intro: Cistanthe ambigua, commonly known as the narrowleaf desertstar, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-gray hue, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Cistanthe ambigua is typically found in disturbed soils and is considered a valuable component of desert ecosystems.
